gurmukhi: ਦੁਹਾਂ ਕੰਧਾਰਾਂ ਮੁਹਿ ਜੁੜੇ; ਨਾਲਿ ਧੳੁਸਾ ਭਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Duhaan Kandhaaraan Muh(i) Jude Naal(i) Dhaousaa Bhdaree||
translation: Both the armies are facing each other alongwith the resounding big trumpet.

gurmukhi: ਕੜਕ ੳੁਠਿਅਾ ਫੳੁਜ ਤੇ; ਵਡਾ ਅਹੰਕਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Kadak Outthiaa Phauj Te Vataa Ahankdaree||
translation: The highly egoist warrior of the army thundered.

gurmukhi: ਲੈ ਕੈ ਚਲਿਅਾ ਸੂਰਮੇ; ਨਾਲਿ ਵਡੇ ਹਜਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Lai Kai Chaliaa Soorme Naal(i) Vade Hajdaree||
translation: He is moving towards the war-arena with thousands of mighty warriors.
Mahishasura pulled out his huge double-edged sword from his scabbard.

gurmukhi: ੳੁ੍ਨਮਲ ਲੱਥੇ ਸੂਰਮੇ; ਮਾਰ ਮਚੀ ਕਰਾਰੀ ॥
translation: The fighters entered the field enthusiastically and there occurred formidable fighting.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਪੇ ਚੱਲੇ ਰਤ ਦੇ; ਸਲਲੇ ਜਟਧਾਰੀ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Jaape Challe Ratt De Sal-le Jatadhdaree||18||
translation: It appears that the blood flows like the water (of Ganges) from the tangled hair of Shiva.18.
When the trumpet, enveloped by the hide of the male buffalo, the vehicle of Yama, sounded, the armies attacked each other.

gurmukhi: ਧੂਹਿ ਲੲੀ ਕਿ੍ਰਪਾਣੀ; ਦੁਰਗਾ ਮਿਅਾਨ ਤੇ ॥
translation: Durga pulled her sword from the scabbard.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਡੀ ਰਾਕਸਿ ਖਾਣੀ; ਵਾਹੀ ਦੈਤ ਨੂੰ ॥
translation: She struck the demon with that Chandi, the devourer of demons (that is the sword).

gurmukhi: ਕੋਪਰ ਚੂਰ ਚਵਾਣੀ; ਲਥੀ ਕਰਗ ਲੈ ॥
translation: It broke the skull and face into pieces and pierced through the skeleton.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਖਰ ਤੁਰਾ ਪਲਾਣੀ; ਰੜਕੀ ਧਰਤ ਜਾੲਿ ॥
translation: And it further pierced through the saddle and caparison of the horse, and struck on the earth supported by the Bull (Dhaul).

gurmukhi: ਲੈਦੀ ਅਘਾ ਸਿਧਾਣੀ; ਸਿੰਗਾਂ ਧੳੁਲ ਦਿਅਾਂ ॥
translation: It moved further and struck the horns of the Bull.
